channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ロサンゼルスの倫理機関が、CBSの元CEOレス・ムーンヴェスに対し、自分に対する性的暴行の訴えに関する警察の機密情報を入手した不正行為で15Kドルの罰金を科す（Gene Maddaus/Variety）
item.description:
Gene Maddaus / Variety:
A Los Angeles ethics agency fines former CBS CEO Les Moonves $15K for misconduct in obtaining confidential police info about a sexual assault claim against him  —  Leslie Moonves, the former CEO of CBS, was fined $15,000 on Wednesday by the L.A. City Ethics Commission for obtaining secret information …

item.title: TikTok、写真とテキストコンテンツを共有するInstagramのライバル「TikTok Notes」をオーストラリアとカナダでAndroidとiOSで限定テスト展開開始（Sheena Vasani/The Verge）
item.description:
Sheena Vasani / The Verge:
TikTok starts rolling out TikTok Notes, its Instagram rival for sharing photo and text content, for limited testing in Australia and Canada on Android and iOS  —  TikTok has started rolling out its Instagram rival, TikTok Notes, to select Android and iOS users “for download and limited testing in Australia and Canada.”

item.title: 米著作権局がAI法と格闘するなか、ある作家がAIから「テキストの選択、調整、配置」の限定的著作権を獲得した方法（Kate Knibbs/Wired）
item.description:
Kate Knibbs / Wired:
How one author gained a limited copyright for the “selection, coordination, and arrangement of text” from AI, as the US Copyright Office wrestles with AI law  —  Elisa Shupe was initially rebuffed when she tried to copyright a book she wrote with help from ChatGPT.

item.title: ニューズウィーク誌のAI活用を紹介。映像制作、AIに特化したライブニュースデスクによる速報、技術者による初稿執筆など（Andrew Deck/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Andrew Deck / Nieman Lab:
A look at Newsweek's use of AI, including in video production, an AI-focused Live News desk for breaking stories, and letting the tech write some first drafts  —  The legacy publication is leaning on AI for video production, a new breaking news team, and first drafts of some stories.

item.title: Parks Associates：米国でインターネットを利用している世帯は、すべての視聴デバイスで週に平均43.5時間ビデオを視聴しており、2020年の37.2時間から増加している。
item.description:
James Careless / TV Tech:
Parks Associates: US households with internet now consume an average 43.5 hours of video per week across all viewing devices, up from 37.2 hours in 2020  —  Those homes are now watching six more hours of video per week than they were in 2020  —  U.S. Internet households now consume …

item.title: フォーブスがAIディープフェイクポルノツールと「ヌーディファイア」テレグラムボットを宣伝する120以上のYouTube動画と27のGoogle広告を発見した後、Googleはそれらを削除した（Thomas Brewster/Forbes）
item.description:
Thomas Brewster / Forbes:
After Forbes found 120+ YouTube videos and 27 Google ads promoting AI deepfake porn tools and “nudifier” Telegram bots, Google took them down  —  The company removed more than 100 YouTube videos after Forbes found the platform was promoting AI nudifiers used by school bullies and a convicted pedophile.

item.title: 約50人のNPRスタッフが、ウリ・ベルリナー氏のエッセイの「事実誤認と誤謬」を公に非難するよう求めるNPR首脳部への書簡に署名（Ben Mullin/@benmullin）
item.description:
Ben Mullin / @benmullin:
About 50 NPR staffers sign a letter to NPR leadership calling for a public rebuke of the “factual inaccuracies and elisions” in Uri Berliner's essay  —  new: About 50 NPR employees sign a letter to CEO Katherine Maher and top editor Edith Chapin calling for, among other things, a public rebuke of the “factual inaccuracies and elisions” in Uri Berliner's Free Press essay. [image]

item.title: ウリ・ベルリナーは、NPRの問題を「分裂的な見解を持つ新CEOに中傷されるようなニュースルームでは働けない」として、NPRを辞職すると語った（Oliver Darcy/CNN）
item.description:
Oliver Darcy / CNN:
Uri Berliner says he is resigning from NPR as he “cannot work in a newsroom where I am disparaged by a new CEO whose divisive views confirm” NPR's problems  —  Uri Berliner, a National Public Radio senior editor who wrote a scathing online essay accusing the public radio network …

item.title: 欧州データ保護委員会は、メタのような大規模なオンライン・プラットフォームは、ターゲット広告なしで無料でサービスを利用できるオプションをユーザーに提供すべきだと述べている（Foo Yun Chee/ロイター）。
item.description:
Foo Yun Chee / Reuters:
The European Data Protection Board says large online platforms like Meta should give users an option to use their services for free without targeted advertising  —  Meta Platforms (META.O) and other large online platforms should give users an option to use their services …

item.title: メディア業界の日刊ニュースレター『トゥデイ・イン・タブズ』の購読者は3万6000人で、そのうち10％程度が月6ドルまたは年50ドルを支払っている。
item.description:
Steven Kurutz / New York Times:
A profile of Rusty Foster, whose Today in Tabs daily media industry newsletter has 36,000 subscribers, of which ~10% pay $6 per month or $50 per year  —  Rusty Foster in his element at his home in Peaks Island, Maine.Greta Rybus for The New York Times  —  In a time when the headlines …

item.title: NPRのCEO、@krmaherへの辞表［画像］（Uri Berliner/@uberliner）
item.description:
Uri Berliner / @uberliner:
My resignation letter to NPR CEO @krmaher [image]

item.title: 2月に米国アプリを閉鎖したスウェーデンのストリーミングサービスViaplayが、Prime Video Channelsで月額5.99ドルの定額制チャンネルを開始（Jesse Whittock/Deadline）
item.description:
Jesse Whittock / Deadline:
Swedish streaming service Viaplay, which shut down its US app in February, launches a $5.99 per month subscription channel on Prime Video Channels  —  Viaplay shut its direct-to-consumer service in February, but the Scandi streamer is still active in the U.S.

item.title: Snapは、SnapchatからエクスポートされたAI生成画像に透かしを追加する予定。透かしは、Snapロゴの半透明バージョンとキラキラした絵文字として表示される（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
Snap plans to add watermarks to AI-generated images exported from Snapchat; the watermarks appear as a translucent version of the Snap logo with a sparkle emoji  —  Social media company Snap said Tuesday that it plans to add watermarks to AI-generated images on its platform.

item.title: ヒュー・グラントは、最大1,000万ポンドの費用を避けるためにニューズ・グループと和解し、「マードックの和解金には悪臭があり、これが口止め料になることを拒否する」と語った（Ellise Shafer/Variety）
item.description:
Ellise Shafer / Variety:
Hugh Grant says he settled with News Group to avoid up to £10M in costs and “Murdoch's settlement money has a stink and I refuse to let this be hush money”  —  As reported by the BBC, Grant reached a settlement on Wednesday regarding allegations of unlawful information gathering against NGN.

item.title: デイリー・ビースト紙が、ジェフ・ベゾスの婚約者ローレン・Sánchezを取材する記者を募集。"スマート・タブロイド "を目指し、テック企業幹部とそのエコシステムを取材する計画の一環（Mike Allen/Axios）
item.description:
Mike Allen / Axios:
The Daily Beast seeks a reporter to cover Jeff Bezos' fiancée Lauren Sánchez, part of plans to become a “smart tabloid” and cover tech execs and their ecosystem  —  - The website also plans aggressive coverage of the royals, in an effort to show up ink-stained Brits.
